item.title: #9 - Plotting in Julia (using Python)
item.description: The first step is to have Julia installed as well as a plotting library. I chose to use PyPlot as it uses Matplotlib which I am used to from Python. Install PyPlot using Pkg.add("PyPlot") at the Julia prompt. Below is an example to generate a Hertzsprung–Russell diagram. # Reading in some data. data = readdlm("stars.txt",' ') temperature = data[:,1] magnitude = data[:,2] # Call the plotting library as below using PyPlot figure(1,figsize=(6,6)) rc("font", family="sans") rc("xtick", labelsize="small") rc("ytick", labelsize="small") scatter(temperature,magnitude,linewidth=2) #ylim(0,0.
